lines.speaker: page
lines.text: Come, come well couch i the castleditch till we see the light of our fairies. Remember, son Slender, my daughter.

lines.speaker: slender
lines.text: Ay, forsooth I have spoke with her and we have a nayword how to know one another: I come to her in white, and cry mum she cries budget and by that we know one another.

lines.speaker: shallow
lines.text: Thats good too: but what needs either your mum or her budget the white will decipher her well enough. It hath struck ten oclock.

lines.speaker: page
lines.text: The night is dark light and spirits will become it well. Heaven prosper our sport! No man means evil but the devil, and we shall know him by his horns. Lets away follow me.
